Opposing Force is really fu cking good, like holy sh it !!!! This game is so neck and neck for me between HL1 and this game. Half-life 1 wins though, but barely. This game is fu cking astounding, I wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if the developers were on drugs when making this game. 

PROS: 
- I love the weapons in this game so much; my favorite being the Spore Launcher and it's my favorite HL weapon in general. There are so many fu cking weapons in this game, like what the fu ck why? BUT I LOVE IT SO MUCH!!! GAVE ME YOUR FU CKING WEAPONS!!! AARRRRRROOOOOOOOOO!!!! Ummmm?? Sorry about that, I don‚Äôt know what that was.
- The story is really good, you play as Adrian Shephard, a marine sent in to clean up the Black Mesa incident. It‚Äôs really good man trust me.
- YOU DON‚ÄôT PLAY THROUGH MUCH OF XEN!! FU CK YEAH!!!
- I love the new enemies too, really good
- For some reason, this game is really fu cking HARD!!!!! And I like that.

Okay so everything else is pretty much in my HL1 review for pros because it‚Äôs an expansion pack, so it‚Äôs basically the same game. Now for the cons‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.

CONS:
- This game is too short, I want to play more god damn it!!
- Honestly, I don‚Äôt care much for the soundtrack. A lot of the tracks feel like they have the same beat. WTF!!???
- I hate the ending because Shephard never comes back in the future games. I‚Äôve always wanted a conclusion to his story, but it never happened. There are some mods out there that do try, like HL2 awakening‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.. does anyone remember that mod? No? Same here. Well, there‚Äôs Prospekt on stream: sorry Rich but your game sucks asss and I didn‚Äôt enjoy it. But it‚Äôs not on my worst mods list of all time like Wilson Chronicles and HTDF, so there‚Äôs that. Anyways Rich, please put your money to good use, I‚Äôm counting on you. *KISS ON THE FOREHEAD* Hopfully you're doing something with that money, right???? Since I mentioned Wilson Chronicles and HDTF, I might as well say how HDTF is worse than when England touched the fu cking White House back in 1814, and Wilson Chronicles makes me want to have a fu cking lobotomy. There‚Äôs Opposing Force 2, looks awesome and fun. TO BAD IT‚ÄôS FU CKING DEAD AND LOST FOREVER!!!  You know, I don't even care if he comes back in HL3 and all he does is just takes a sh it and then dies right after. I just what to know what the happened to him.

Yeah, that‚Äôs about it for me, I love this game from my heart to my di ck. But don‚Äôt play this game first if you've never played Half-life before, play Half-life 1 first then play this game. Anyways, I love you OPFOR!!!

Very nice game

[h1]Those marines were buff as hell.[/h1]

+ Play your cards right and the NPCs may help you out.
+ Impressive physics for its time and semi-destructible environment.
+ Fair amount of enemies and huge variety of weapons and explosives.
+ All around impressive sound effects and game soundtrack.
+ Hard difficulty is challenging and ammo is scarce.
+ Xen (best part of Half-Life) and your displacer cannon.

- OpenGL stuck at 75~100 fps (w/wo vsync) and the software renderer doesn't work.
- You may recall getting stuck in elevators (due to high fps) which still happens.
- No handholding (which is good) but you have to figure out everything by yourself.

Great FPS, particularly in regard to level-design and varying pace. If you haven't played the game before I'd estimate you'll get 7-8 hours from start to finish.
The only real criticism I have is in comparison to the original Half-Life, is Opposing Force ends rather suddenly and without any real sense of a final difficulty spike or climax.
La expansion que mas me he gozado, tanta variedad de armas es emocionante, ademas de que posee algo mas de dificultad que los juegos anteriores.

The already flawless themes of the original game fits this expansion perfectly. Opposing Force is really special, it adds new enemy types and weapons into the game, but its main star comes from expanding the already grand Half-Life universe with the dramatic story of a soldier tasked with eliminating Freeman.

Having just completed Opposing Force, I can safely say that Blue Shift is my favorite of the Half-Life expansions. The problems I have with Half-Life's gameplay are too prevalent in the original game, and Opposing Force. I think I am just not the type of gamer that Half-Life appeals to. I prefer more run and gun, as opposed to the platforming and puzzle solving. If you loved Half-Life, then you will enjoy this expanson as well. Recommended if you are already a fan of the series.
Beaucoup mieux que l'extention Blue Shift

10/10 ign

This game is awesome! I'm so happy that I bought Half Life Collection. I never knew it was created and I regret not knowing! You should really play it! IMHO this has the best character in the whole universe(Shephard). Everything is awesome about this expansion.

This is a classic with the original Half-Life series that takes place in the same concurrent universe. Although it is a bit old now and the graphics are dated, if you are a fan of Half-Life or want to simply see where parts of game history were made, I would highly recommend giving it a try (after playing Half-Life of course).

Rating: 8.0/10

Recommend Price: $4.99 is worth it if you want to own history (or just get it in some valve bundle if you are hardcore)

Nagyon √∂tletes, hogy √°t√©lhetj√ºk a Half Life 1 t√∂rt√©n√©seit az ellens√©ges katon√°k szempontj√°b√≥l is. Szeretem az ilyet j√°t√©kokban. Ezenk√≠v√ºl √∫j fegyverek, sz√∂rnyek √©s funkci√≥k is tal√°lhat√≥ak a j√°t√©kban.

Expans√µes, como eram chamadas na √©poca onde DLCs ou epis√≥dios n√£o existiam para extorquir seu dinheiro m√∫ltiplas vezes, serviam para dar continuidade para a hist√≥ria do jogo base, mas muitas expans√µes sofreram o problema de ser, bom, irrelevantes. Mas mesmo sendo esquecido, Opposing Force tem uma proposta interessante: Ver pelo lado de um dos seus inimigos. 
 

Recapitula√ß√£o r√°pida: Voc√™ √© Adrian Shepard, cabo da HECU, respons√°vel da invas√£o no jogo base. Voc√™ come√ßa o jogo em um avi√£o, a caminho da Black Mesa, mas voc√™ sabe como helic√≥pteros funcionam em jogos. Enfim, depois da queda, Adrian se v√™ sem ordens claras, e tenta escapar da Black Mesa a todos os custos. 
O conte√∫do novo aqui √© bem meh, para falar a verdade. As armas novas s√£o armas j√° presentes no jogo base, mas com um reskin, como a Desert Eagle sendo basicamente uma Magnum mais r√°pida, e a faca de combate rapidamente botando a chave inglesa para ser obsoleta. Os √∫nicos destaques que posso citar s√£o o Barnacle Grapple, que funciona como um gancho e √© criminalmente pouco usado, e o Displacer Cannon, que √© a t√≠pica arma de √∫ltimo recurso contra inimigos gigantes.
E para os inimigos novos, a maioria tamb√©m s√£o um reskin de inimigos presentes no jogo original. Outros, como o Pit Drone, parecem curiosamente com um jogo que conhe√ßo, e o Voltigore, cujo voc√™ deve rezar para n√£o encontrar. 
Uma das oportunidades perdidas foram os soldados. O jogo apresenta v√°rios tipos de soldados diferentes, como o engenheiro, que consegue derrubar portas e abrir caminhos alternativos, e o MEEEEDIC, que obviamente te cura. O problema com os soldados √© que enquanto fora do combate, a intelig√™ncia deles √© horr√≠vel e voc√™ precisa literalmente guiar eles para eles poderem te seguir direito. Ou seja, quando funciona √© incr√≠vel, mas quando n√£o funciona...
Mas n√£o se preocupe, porque esses n√£o s√£o problemas maiores. A variedade apresentada em Half-Life ainda persiste aqui, com um level design que cof cof, ouso dizer melhor que o jogo original, por ser mais consistente e sem cap√≠tulos mais ma√ßantes. 
 E, para ser honesto, a Gearbox melhor fez seu trabalho enquanto esteve na sombra da obra que a Valve originalmente criou. Sem as adi√ß√µes, seria basicamente um mission pack (como o seu sucessor), mas na realidade *√©* um mission pack, coisa que eu creio que a Gearbox foi perceber nos momentos finais do jogo.

Esquecido por n√£o ser memor√°vel, Opposing Force faz um bom extra para Half-Life, sendo meh em alguns pontos e √≥timo em outros. Distinto, criativo, e divertido: Tudo o que uma expans√£o era e deve ser.

Half-life opposing force, DLC del juego principal, en esta entrega nos sumergimos en el papel de uno de los antagonistas principales del juego principal (la marina de los EEUU) en el personaje de el cabo Adrian Shephard en el cual podemos tener otra perspectiva de C√≥mo se vivencio el desastre de Black Mesa, cosas que valen destacar de esta entrega son las nuevas armas tanto humanas como tipo Xen, tambi√©n resalt√≥ el cambio en los aliens, la perspectiva antag√≥nica enriquece a√∫n m√°s la tradici√≥n de half-life haciendo su historia mas rica en materia de protagonismo y trama en el cual todos los hilos se unen en uno solo para desentra√±ar una historia llena de enigmas y conspiraci√≥n (y s√≠, me refiero al origen G-Man), en el aspecto de los gr√°ficos y la interfaz este DLC mantiene su relaci√≥n y aspecto con el juego principal, en el aspecto de multijugador debo decir que la mayor√≠a de servers se encuentran disponibles, aunque siempre se reporta errores a la hora de entrar en determinado servers.

-Modalidad de juego: shooter en primera persona, supervivencia, acci√≥n, ciencia ficci√≥n

-Mi calificaci√≥n: 9.6/10

-Recomendado: 96 de 100

-Gr√°ficos: buenos para la epoca

-Multijugador: medianamente bueno 

-Calidad en el modo de juego (controles, √≠tems‚Ä¶): buena 

-historia: excelente

L'histoire de Half-Life vu d'un autre angle, une tr√®s bonne id√©e. Le jeu est 2 fois moins long que l'histoire originel mais le sc√©nario est tr√®s bien r√©aliser, tout comme le reste. Ce jeu est futuriste pour son √©poque √† tous les niveaux. Prenez le en promo car il reste assez court.

La mejro expansion de half life en mi opinion, este juego es mas dedicado a la accion que a los puzzles, a√±ade nuevos enemigos y armas a la trama y te da una vision de la historia desde un punto distinto, puede ser dificil para los nuevos en la saga pero de verdad vale la pena
De todas las expansiones del primer Half-Life, esta es la que m√°s contenido nuevo tiene. En mi opini√≥n, jugablemente es mucho m√°s s√≥lido que el Blue-Shift.

In my opinion the best Half Life 1 DLC there is.

Switch sides and play as one of the Soldiers hunting Gordon Freeman. New Weapons, new alien enemys and some new gameplay mechanics (Steering a big a** mortar and bombarding alien waves, A hookshot alike Barnacle Grapple weapon which lets you even consume enemys), new story elements as you play the "bad" guys.
Haven`t tried the multiplayer yet, but i quickly fell in love with this game! Good mix of fighting, story and puzzle.
If you liked Half Life 1, i can only recommend opposing force to continue enjoying the half life series :))
This game actually makes me feel like a real soilder. Good job game!

ARE YOU TOUCHING ME, DIRTBAG?
–®–∏–∫–∞—Ä–Ω–æ–µ DLC! –•–æ—Ä–æ—à–∏–π —Å—é–∂–µ—Ç, –≥–µ–π–º–ø–ª–µ–π, —É–ª—É—á—à–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫–∞ - Half-Life: Opposing Force –ø—Ä–µ–≤–æ—Å—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç –æ—Ä–∏–≥–∏–Ω–∞–ª!

Not short and sweet like Blue Shift, and not nearly as engaging as Half-Life itself, Opposing Force is an interesting side story which ultimately is dragged incredibly far, and wears its welcome thin.

In this one, you play 'Adrian Shepard' and you're just a marine. The game goes on forever, it just keeps going, on and on and on and on, it picks up some time late in Half-Life. There's actually, shockingly no clear plot or anything, since maybe a chapter or two in you get to the point where you're going to leave Black Mesa with the rest of the soldiers, and G-Man steps in to stop you... for some reason, and then the rest of the game is just nonsense. You just... go through Black Mesa, fightin' and killin' everything in your way.

The only things not hostile to you this time are Black Mesa personnel and fellow soldiers, but there's a new faction of 'black ops' troops who are out to get you... for some reason, so you have to fight those guys. For the most part, your enemies are pretty much just vortigaunts, houndeyes and headcrabs for the first half of the game, then after about that point you're just fighting these weird lookin things which run up and claw you, and then for the last third or so it's almost exclusively these giant things that spit purple lightning balls at you, and these ground troops which shoot blue laser balls.

It's actually horrible, everything does huge amounts of damage to you and there's not much you can do to stop it. I never felt so consistently outgunned in any of the other games, and it might have something to do with the fact that after about the halfway mark, I think Gearbox just completely forgot about giving you anything to do with HP or armor. You're supposed to be able to charge up your combat armor with these military grade chargers as well as the HEV suit chargers, and during training you even see a third party one, but honestly I think I only saw one or maybe two military chargers during the whole game.

Additionally, health is a huge problem. After that halfway mark or so, they just stop placing the medkits on walls, so you only have rarely, a big bunch of crates in a room that have maybe 3-4 health kits as items which restore about 15 hp each, so gaining 45 to 60 health at once. This is nice, but I really felt up against it for that entire third or half of the game, if you ever make a mistake and drop to like 10 or 20 hp, that's it, that's pretty much all you get for what feels like another chapter or so.

There's this one really annoying bit where there's this tunnel system with a whole ton of these spider lookin things that shoot purple lightning, and they take a LOT of hits to kill, and I mean a LOT, like multiple shots with a rocket launcher. I found that the BFG or whatever it is does about 1-shot them as long as you hit them with it, but you only get five shots anyway.

I think it says a lot that I played this game for not even 5 hours, and it felt like 10.

The first third of the game or so feels pretty good, it's fun enough, and playing as Shepard is novel enough to keep you interested, but from then on, perhaps after G-Man stops you boarding the helicopter out, that's when the game just sort of takes a dive. I don't know why, it just stops being fun. Maybe it's because they never really give you anything else to do, and the game culminates in an absolutely pathetic excuse for a boss fight. It doesn't even work properly on Linux, what I found is that once you kill the boss, its model sort of bugs out and it instantly disappears, and it doesn't let you finish the game unless you manually change level to it via the console.

There's some other issues too, like the game not giving you weapons early enough. For example, the Barnacle. You get an actual Barnacle as a 'gun' in this game. You just kind of use it to grapple enemies, you can grab headcrabs and they are tugged right into the maw of the Barnacle, chomp, it's crunched into a giblets. But, anything larger than that, and you get pulled towards it like a grappling hook. Now, everyone knows grappling hooks are super awesome, why didn't they give it to us earlier? You get it only a couple chapters before the end of the game!

Like Counter-Strike: Condition Zero Deleted Scenes, there's a bunch of stuff in the tutorial which doesn't really feel like it's made enough of a big deal of in the game itself. An example is the ropes, in Opposing Force you can climb ropes which act kind of like actual physics objects, it's very impressive, the only issue is the game doesn't really do much with them. I'm not sure if it was a technical limitation or not, but either way, they're very few and far between and the only few times you get to use them are usually just... climbing up a small distance you could have just had a ladder for.

A better use could have been something like... having you use an elevator, it stops, so you need to grab onto the electrical cable and climb down instead while it plummets down below and explodes. That'd be cool! People like seeing stuff blow up. Instead, they're almost all 'just kind of there'.

I should talk a little more about the final boss. It's just a big squid, it can't move, and to kill it you just shoot it in each eye with a pair of laser guns you have to press E to use, and then you shoot it in it's... portal mouth thing until it dies. It's boring, not challenging, and while the Nihilanth in Half-Life is constantly speaking to you, whispering stuff in your ear like as soon as you get to Xen, this thing just kind of shows up! A guard says "hey there's a bad thing coming through a portal and you gotta kill it" and you do that and that's the end of the game. It just ends, G-Man shows up to tell you you're going to be put away now and then it ends. It's very disappointingy.

It's a shame that we never really got a sequel or anything, I'd actually love to see that today, with a stronger emphasis on the differences between the scientist, Dr. Freeman and the veteran soldier, Corporal Adrian Shepard, but... Gearbox is a huge company now, and they probably wouldn't even care about doing it. Valve don't really make games anymore, and everyone's kind of forgotten about Half-Life.

I can't say I disliked Opposing Force, some parts of it are really great. The soldiers are ALL just hamming it up, it's great, you get an intro that's reminiscent of Predator, there's one part with a trash compactor which is like 1:1 with the scene from Star Wars, and the few occasions you get to lead around some of your fellow soldiers, it's fun, it's good, it's just a shame it can't remain like that throughout the whole thing. I'd give it like a thumbs sideways, but since I have to pick one, my affection for the game outweighs my disdain.
Half-Life 1 but you play as a cannon-fodder.

A nice game. Not as interesting as the main series, but a great thing to do while waiting for hl3...
(Also definetly check out the hidden script and entity names, it's quite cool)

A pretty expansion pack. You know, back when games had these instead of DLC?

My favorite part is when Adrian Shephard sees Gordon and he shouts, "Hey get back here, you big orange fuck!"

Poter vivere gli eventi del disastro di Black Mesa da una prospettiva opposta a quella di Gordon Freeman √® stata un'ottima scelta. Interessanti le nuove armi disponibili. Da giocare insieme ad Half-Life e alla successiva espansione.

Meet fierce alien opponents, and experiment with new weaponry. Named 'Game of the Year' by the Academy of Interactive Arts and Sciences.

Great DLC
–∫—Ä—É—Ç–æ

In my experience DLC doesn't tend to be as good as the main game itself, but this time that was different.It was probably just as hard but this felt easier(most of it anyway). You play as a man called Shepard who is a soldier in the army who has been sent to secure the Black Mesa facility, but unlike the rest of the soldiers, you aren't corrupt and actually try and save the facility by carrying on after everyone else has left. The toughest enemies where the invisible ones and the black ops agents.it took me around half an hour to finish the last boss because i didn't know you had to shoot the purple thing. This game is a must-have purchase if you are into problem-solving or action games. But be warned it is an older game so it has a lot less handholding.
